Datatable.LocalizationPair: Mezan

This is the planet of origin of all the humanoid bipeds in the galaxy. Successive waves of colonists departed from Mezan to find less crowded or less restricting places in the galaxy--the Mezari, the Raians, the Collective, and certainly others. Once a jewel of a planet, it has become a tragic, windswept vista of cinders and ruins. There are many theories as to what happened to Mezan, with the primary suspects being overexploitation, civil war, and invasion. It will take time and research to find out what the truth is, and what is science as opposed to rumor, legend, and propaganda. In the meantime, Mezan awaits its next inhabitants, guarding its secrets in ash-cloaked silence.
Chapter 1: Unexpected Entropy

An emissary from the Academy arrives, dressed formally. They only agree to speak or communicate in public venues while being recorded; this is no ordinary discussion. It appears that the head of the Academy is indisposed, and various organizations within the Academy are beginning to operate with a certain degree of independence. You are provided with a few names, a list, a small explanation--really a marketing brochure--on the Academy's structure and organization. Once the discussions are over, you place an encrypted call to the Hero in your employ, who is visibly uncomfortable. "You understand," they say, "we are beings of exceptional power. We are trained to seek only strength and knowledge, but..." "Some seek more," you finish. "Yes. And there are... associations. Fraternities. Within the Academy. Theoretically just clubs for Heroes with shared interests. Those who seek power often use them for leverage, however. In research, training, exploration..." None of this is shocking, though it makes you uneasy. "But as long as they lack access to resources," you say, "they are not a threat. At least, not to friendly empires..." Your employee nods, as if agreeing, and prepares to end the discussion. Then, at the last second, changes their mind. They add, "Remember that there are unclaimed places of enormous wealth. Out there. And everyone is starting to look at them." The transmission is terminated, leaving you curious. And concerned.
SEARCHING
Seek the "unclaimed places" that your Hero spoke of.
Discover $Amount01Name Systems outside of your Constellation
Other Constellations can be found with Probes and some Quests or Events, or by unlocking the Autonomous Materials technology (wormholes).

As reports of new systems and their contents come in, other reports arrive as well. It seems that Heroes are departing the Academy on individual missions, not at Isyander’s request. This independence is unusual, though it is not a full rebellion. At least, not yet.
MAPPING
Seek the "unclaimed places" that your Hero spoke of.
Discover $Amount02Name additional Systems in this galaxy
Ships can be set to automatically explore using the "Auto-explore" Fleet Action.

As reports of new systems and their contents come in, other reports arrive as well. It seems that Heroes are departing the Academy on individual missions, not at Isyander’s request. This independence is unusual, though it is not a full rebellion. At least, not yet.
INFORMATION
Seek information about possible "unclaimed places" in the galaxy.
Investigate $Amount03Name new Curiosities
Use Probes on Ships with the "Exploration" Role to explore Curiosities.

You are learning more than the contents of new Curiosities; your crews are clever and your equipment, reliable. Apparently, Heroes are departing the Academy on independent missions, flaunting the Academy hierarchy. It is unusual, though it is not a full rebellion. At least, not yet.
Choice Locked: Need Unique Constellation.
Choice Locked: Need Multiple Constellations.
Chapter 2: Seek the Unique--Part 1

It seems that after centuries of study, Isyander is finally coming close to unlocking key mysteries in the history of the Lost. This close to his goal he has become distracted and vague; he has time for little else than his lifelong obsession. Submitting to his obsession, however, has left his organization adrift and unguided. The result is that some Heroes no longer feel the need to obey his orders, while others simply forget to ask his permission. As the mystery of the turmoil is resolved, that of the "unclaimed places" becomes clearer as well. You have learned that some of the Hero fraternities view the Unique Planets as anybody’s treasure—first come, first served. Beneath the serenity of the great void a race is heating up to discover and exploit the enormous riches and power that these planets represent. Some view them as resources to be strip-mined, others view them as historical sites to be studied. Which one are you?
COMPARE
Investigate the status of the Curiosities around these Unique Planets; knowledge will always be power.
Search $Amount01Name of the identified Curiosities
Use Probes on Ships with the "Exploration" Role to explore Curiosities.

Your crews have found traces of activity in unusual places. Scans indicate the presence of Ops and Limo Hero-class ships, as well as recent extractions of samples. Something needs to be done to restore the center of power in the Academy.
SINGULAR
If there are riches to be had, it is best to keep them out of the hands of powerful splinter factions of the Academy.
Colonize or create an Outpost on $Amount03Name Unique Planets in less than $Timer [turn]
You may need to research additional Colonization technologies to do this. Search by target planet type in the search field of the Technology Screen.

The differences between the various associations seem to be largely philosophical, though in a place where thoughts control Dust powers, even philosophies wield tremendous physical power. And philosophies of the unique planets are legion.
Colonize a total of $Amount05Name planets in less than $Timer [turn]
The competition to colonize unique planets is fierce, and you lag behind it. But there are ways to get ahead, if you are willing.
The competition to colonize unique planets is fierce, and you lag behind it. But you can still triumph, if you are willing.
Chapter 2: Seek the Unique--Part 2

You have learned a new name. The structure of the Academy is both ancient and complex, with many Pathfinders--Isyander's first allies and supporters--fulfilling key roles. It is in this way that you meet Ighszraasz the Sophon, known as "The Distrustful", who is surprisingly not a leader of science and research but an expert on communication, organization and information. As one of the primary leaders of the slave rebellion that was launched with Isyander's escape, his obsession with discretion and the compartmentalization of knowledge was put to great use in maintaining the mystery and secrecy surrounding the development and the location of the Academy. With the tools of the Academy at his disposal, and abetted by his eventual communion with Dust, Ighszraaz was able to instill discretion and concealment in the very bones of the culture that grew up around the Academy. He has contacted you, in the name of the Academy, requesting some simple assistance. Apparently.
COLLATE
A recently recruited Hero without ties to a major empire would be a valuable asset on the Unique Planet.
Assign $HeroDefinitionNameName to a System and raise its level to $Amount01Name.
Heroes can be assigned from the Star System Management screen or from the Hero Management screen.

Ighszraasz is thankful, and shows this by not hacking into your security systems. $HeroDefinitionNameName has been faithful to their oaths of loyalty, and parts of the Academy are coming back under control. Other parts, of course, are getting worse.
Chapter 2: Seek the Unique--Part 2

You have learned a new name. The structure of the Academy is both ancient and complex, and different Pathfinders--Isyander's first allies and supporters--fulfill key roles. It is in this way that you hear of Colorless, an oddly named Craver, who is both a fanatically loyal follower of Isyander and the sharp edge of the Academy's power. Leader of guards, fleets, and troops, Colorless is known to be unforgiving both to the enemy and to his own soldiers. Cold, professional, and unrelentingly driven, Colorless found once again in the Academy the home and hive whose loss had set him adrift. As the right hand of Isyander in all matters requiring physical force, he is the Academy's greatest military hero. As an interesting side note, the Tamad-class Hero ship is named for a multi-limbed martial art developed by Colorless after studying many races—including, improbably, the Kalgeros. Colorless has indicated that it would be nice if you could assign a certain Hero to a certain role. It would be an exceedingly bad idea to disagree with this simple request.

You have learned a new name. The structure of the Academy is both ancient and complex, and different Pathfinders--or rebellious slaves, to the Church--fulfill key roles. It is in this way that you hear of Colorless, an oddly named Craver, who is both a fanatically loyal follower of Isyander and the sharp edge of the Academy's power. Leader of guards, fleets, and troops, Colorless is known to be unforgiving both to the enemy and to his own soldiers. Cold, professional, and unrelentingly driven, Colorless found once again in the Academy the home and hive whose loss had set him adrift. As the right hand of Isyander in all matters requiring physical force, he is the Academy's greatest military hero. As an interesting side note, the Tamad-class Hero ship is named for a multi-limbed martial art developed by Colorless after studying many races—including, improbably, the Kalgeros. Colorless has indicated that it would be nice if you could assign a certain Hero to a certain role. You will learn more of the Heretic's organization and goals if you comply...
EXPLOIT
Put your Hero in control of a colonized Unique Planet--and watch them closely.
Assign the Hero $HeroDefinitionNameName level $Amount01Name or more to the System $MySpecialSystemName.
A Hero is able to earn experience if they are assigned to a Fleet as Admiral or to a System as a Governor.

Colorless appreciates your aid. In your brief discussion, he explains his name: the Craver lacks the yellow of cowardice, the red of anger, the blue of despair, or the green of envy. It has no more emotion than a weapon, and it is wielded by Isyander.
Sytems--and Heroes--do not always do what you expect. But failure is a learning process, and you can still recover and overcome this setback.
Assign the Hero $HeroDefinitionNameName level $Amount01Name or more to the System $MySpecialSystemName.
Chapter 3: Ancient Secrets

Messages from Ighszraasz appear in places they shouldn't be able to get to; even when bathing they are difficult to avoid. He is asking that you increase your investments in research and science in order to help the Academy work out the hidden enigmas of the unique planets more rapidly than the rogue Heroes do. He is less interested in what branch of science than in the general advancement, for as a master of cross-referencing and data discovery any research is helpful. You tell him, bluntly, that if he needs CPU cycles you can build a site for him. It seems that he prefers the intuition and hypothesis generation as well as the analysis and conclusions generated by living or mechnical brains, and finds that far more valuable than simple number crunching. You ask him how he wishes the information to be transmitted, and he laughs. "I'll know it as soon as you do," he says, and ends the call.
ACCELERATION
It is important to find Unique Planets, but it is critical to understand their mysteries.
Unlock $Amount01Name Technologies in less than $Timer [turn].
You can use Hero Skills, Improvements, and some Luxury Resources to increase Science production.

Your researchers are tired and other parts of your economy beg for investment, but Ighszraaz's request has been fulfilled. Strangely, Ighszraaz himself is no longer in contact with you. An assistant, a Z'vali named D'Vex, claims ignorance of the Sophon's whereabouts.
Your exhausted researchers beg forgiveness; in spite of their efforts you have not fulfilled Ighszraasz's request. To improve your image at the Academy may be possible, but embarrassing.
Chapter 3: Ancient Forces

You learn more from Colorless, and from your most trusted Heroes, who explain that the management of the Academy is divided into three main organizations. The first, known as Respect and Remembrance, is led by a Mezari woman and deals with the study of Lost sites both at the Academy and wherever they are found across the galaxy. The second, known simply as Operations, is led by a Sower Hero; they run the day-to-day operations of the Academy complex and its associated factories, farms, fleets, trading empire, and embassies. The third, known as Integrity, is the military branch of the Academy and features the smallest though by far most dangerous military organization in the entire galaxy. Their advice is unanimous: Great changes, and most certainly war, are coming to the Endless galaxy. Some blame this on Isyander's obsession with the Lost, others on the risks and turmoil caused by the rogue Heroes. To prevail or even survive, you must have firm control of your people and your empire.
CAUTION
The power of the unique planets is seductive, but to delve into their secrets you must first be in control of your own empire.
Reach $Amount01Name [prestigeColored] and $Amount02Name [happinessColored] in your Empire
[prestigeColored] and [happinessColored] can be increased through Improvements, Hero Skills, and Luxury Resources used in System Upgrade projects.

As you bask in the glory of your empire, an amusing note arrives. It seems that the planet-wide brain of Teonha generates enormous numbers of unused processor cycles. Apparently, your colonists are harnessing this to develop a new technology: astro-neurobiological hacking.
MYSTERIOUS
Sahar and Veil are planets that are misunderstood by scientists. More research--and researchers--will be necessary to pierce their mysteries.
Have $Amount04Name [population] in your Empire.
Food is the primary Resource for increasing population. Certain Luxury Resources can also boost Food production.

Knowledge is its own reward. You have discovered interesting facts about Veil and Sahar. The first was a "honey pot", created as a lure to entrap Concrete Endless during the Dust Wars. As for Sahar, some suspect that its strange geometries encode physical and mathematical laws; a sort of "bar code" for the galaxy by a long-lost species who wished to immortalize their most important discoveries.
ENDLESS
To pierce the mysteries of the Endless, we will need a higher level of technology, culture, and society.
Possess $Amount05Name Systems of at least level $Amount06Name
System level is increased through System Development Upgrades in the Economy screen.

You have learned much about your populations and your systems. You have also learned that Integrity, the military branch of the Academy, has been led since its inception by Colorless. You also learn that, since its founding, it has been undefeated. Someone in the Academy likes to track their metrics...
Choice Locked: Not a Sophon or Vaulter Empire
Choice Locked: Teonha not colonized
Choice Locked: Neither Sahar nor Veil colonized
Choice Locked: Must be non-Humanoid Empire
Choice Locked: Must be Humanoid Empire
Chapter 3: Ancient Mysteries

Another member of Isyander's inner circle is in contact with you--a highly suspicious Sophon known as Ighszraasz, whose calls cannot be blocked and whose messages show up on devices that nobody knows exist. It seems that he is Isyander's chief of information security, and he is showing great interest in your Heros' assignments. He asks simply that you improve the experience and skills of a Hero, and that he will learn all he needs to know by tracking the progress. When you ask how he expects to get the information, he rolls his eyes and rattles off a list of your passwords, data keys, and makes a snide comment about the contents of your personal safe.
INTEGRATION
See that your Heroes gain both experience and power, or they may seek it elsewhere.
Level a Hero up to at least level $Amount01Name.
Governor Heroes level up faster by building Improvements and defending planets; Admiral Heroes by exploring and winning battles.

The Academy spymaster--for he is that, as well as many other things--nods at your report. He is restless and short-tempered, and you learn a few Sophon words that perhaps you should not have. But he appreciates results, and you have delivered.
Chapter 4: The Eye of the Storm

You are waiting to hear from the mercurial Sophon again, or perhaps his assistant, when you are contacted by a different leader. She simply calls herself Chloris, a Mezari ship captain, once the commander of Kinete Muldaur and the military strategist behind the rebellion. Her interests turned to science and archaeology, and it fell to her to organize much of the construction of the new metropolis around the sacred ruins left by the Lost. Now one of the foremost experts on Endless technology and lore, she is asking that you build research and academic centers--urgently--to maintain the balance of power in the galaxy and within the factions of the Academy. During your brief discussion, you learn that the Fedez-class Hero ship ("Drop") was named in memory of the Mezan professor who instructed her when she was a Vodyani slave. She comments that the Fedez-class ships are lethal offensive weapons, which is a fitting memorial...
ARCHAEOLOGY
Secrets are meant to be unraveled; science will provide the tool.
Build $Amount01Name [scienceColored] #52c9e7#Science#REVERT# Improvements
You can build Improvements more quickly by increasing Industry or by doing a Buyout if you have unlocked the Multi-Thread Management technology.

Chloris and Ighszraasz apparently share an opinion on rebellions and uncontrolled assets. As your scientific discoveries boost the deeper insights of the Academy, there is agreement that a wider variety of experiences coming from unusual, eclectic sources can only help their cause.
Chapter 4: The Eye of the Storm

Isyander himself has taken time out of his studies to speak with you. His presence is powerful and charismatic, even across light-years of distance. His voice is seductive, his logic flawless, and the speed at which his thoughts and logic flow have you sweating to keep up. The internal crisis of the Academy is coming to a head, though he believes that an even greater crisis looms beyond that. It seems that Muvel--the name of the site upon which the Academy was built--is a locus of enormous energies, either due to actions of the Endless and the Lost, or due to Isyander's own studies. Regardless, treasure and/or treachery await; you must order a Hero to discover what certain ancient Curiosities are hiding. Most importantly, you must do this before the rogue associations from the Academy exploit it and decide to use it against Isyander--or you.
ASSISTANCE
There is something out there, and you are not the only one who is interested.
Send a Hero Level $Amount02Name to the marked Curiosity.
A fast ship is recommended.

Mezan is of vital interest for those in your nation who are interested in culture. Or history. Or anthropology. Or, in fact, themselves. It represents the birthplace, the cradle, the creche; for all human descendants of the Mezari it was once home.
INQUIRY
There is something out there, and you are not the only one who is interested.
Send a Hero Level $Amount02Name to the marked Curiosity.
A fast ship is recommended.

Chiark was, apparently, a place of special communion for the Endless and the Lost. It was not a Lodestone, a place of worship, but rather a place where the galaxy's greatest sentiences tested and teased each other in riddles of space and time.
Choice Locked: Not Sophon or Vaulter Empire
Chapter 4: The Eye of the Storm

Ighszraasz is unimpressed by your inability to properly fund research and development. Unlike other Sophons, however, he is still willing to talk to you in spite of that. Convinced that galaxy-wide conflict is coming, he recommends that you buy your way back into Isyander's good graces. It is hardly an elegant or subtle idea, but like all Sophons, Ighszraasz is a pragmatist first. Judgemental and annoying, but a pragmatist.
OBEISANCE
Isyander is not impressed by failure, but his benediction can be bought…
Send a Hero to the marked Curiosity on the Academy System when you're ready to sacrifice $Amount01Name [Strat05orichalcixColored]
Everything has its price.

Isyander is deep in his studies, and barely acknowledges your efforts. Ighszraasz is no longer responding to your missives, but has shown no sign of hostility. Meangingless diplomatic notes arrive and depart into a void... For an entitiy of such power, the Academy seems worryingly fragile.
Chatper 5: Hearth and Home

In life one must deal with things of interest and with things of priority. Sadly, the two are not always identical. While you deal with the societal repercussions of the discovery of Mezan, the events in the Academy and the depradations of the rogue Heroes still preoccupy you. In trying to understand the risks and challenges of dealing with the Academy malcontents, you understand more about the organization of the Academy--which is not as simple as it appears from the outside. It's not really a religious cult, nor is it an organization dedicated solely to science and archaeology. The archaeological site that is Muvel, for instance, is the subject of both daily observances and of remembrance and meditation. While the Academicians attempt to extract all the information about the Lost that they can from the site, some sub-groups argue for ecology--to leave it as it is for future genreratins. It is therefore a living excavation undergoing constant study, and the respect for its original builders is not greater than the scientific desire to understand and decrypt its lore and mechanisms.
GENEALOGY
Your presence on Mezan has grown--and attracted too much attention.
Send a fleet of $Amount01Name [shipCrew] to the planet Mezan!
You can increase Fleet Manpower through the use of Support Modules.

There are many Heroes in many empires that are of Mezari origin. Under banners of peace--or completely surreptitiously--they come to touch the ground and see the ruins, wondering about their past. Gazing on this long-lost homeworld, they are humbled, and their petty desires for power and fortune seem immature and foolish. It seems that the discovery of this planet has bought peace, however temporarily, for Isyander. Let us hope it lasts.
Mezan can be invaded or destroyed...
Chapter 5: Defend the Frontier

The organization of the Academy is not as simple as it appears from the outside. Generally accused of being a religious city state, existing only to worship the Lost, in fact the Academy is dedicated more to science and archaeology in the hopes of discovering a way to atone for the sins of the Endless. There is indeed an ancient site attributed to the Lost that is carefully preserved beneath the center of the vast Academy complex, and it is also true that there are daily moments of remembrance and meditation. However in the place of scriptures or rituals there are textbooks and work shifts, as the Academicians are in fact attempting to uncover all the information they can about the Lost from the site. It is therefore a living excavation undergoing constant study, and the respect for its original builders is not greater than the scientific desire to understand and decrypt its history and mechanisms.
DISCOVERY
Your presence on Chiark has grown--and attracted too much attention.
Send a fleet of $Amount01Name [shipCrew] to the planet Chiark!
You can increase Fleet Manpower through the use of Support Modules.

Heroes cannot escape the desire to test themselves against puzzles designed by and for the gods. You only learn of their presence when they wish it, but Chiark has gained an almost holy status in the eyes of the many Academy graduates that secretly visit. As Heroes face challenges older and more impressive than themselves, their perspectives change, and their desires for power and control begin to seem unimportant, if not childish. It seems that you have bought peace, however temporarily, for Isyander.
Chiark can be invaded or destroyed...
Chapter 5: Trust in Authority

Part of the troubles plaguing the Academy are a result of its structure. It has two primary centers of study or education, and they often compete for resources and attention. One of them is involved in the historical study of the Lost and Endless ruins and their technological analysis. The other is the public face, because this first, core purpose is voluntarily kept hidden from outsiders. This second domain includes the perception of Hero candidates, their filtering based on their potential, their training and education, and, eventually, the vast galaxy-wide service business of renting out their skills to interested organizations. Isyander's deepening interest in the first center has left the second with less oversight and control than it needs.
QUELL
There is disaffection within the Academy, and within your Systems. Maintain your prestige.
Produce $Amount01Name [prestigeColored] on the Empire.
Influence can be increased with Planetary and System Improvements, some Hero Skills, and Luxury Resources used in System Development Upgrades

As the fame and power of your empire grows, the squabbling Heroes take a step back and reconsider their choices. Do they wish to start their own empires, or would they prefer to explore, study, and test themselves against the forces of history? Agreements are reached, memorandums are signed, and the life of the Academy begins to return to normal. The problem has not gone away. But, for the moment, it has receded. The Academy leaders are grateful, even impressed, and that is no small feat.
Chapter 5: To Maintain Discipline

In thanks for your help, Chloris recommends that you speak with another founder of the Academy--RH1nD, a Sower who is its operational manager of the Academy. They have developed an entire--and highly specific--management science, dedicated to the operation of massive non-profit archaeological excavations with a large service arm and a heavy military presence. Extremely efficient, detailed, and obscure, the entire set of organizations, processes, technological infrastructures, and sentient resources is known simply as “Gatas”; one of the Hero ship classes (Limo) is named for it. RH1nD is eager to share their knowledge with you, and urges a complex construction of legal frameworks as the most efficient way to both advance your affairs and ease the Academy's troubles.
VISION
The future looks challenging; make sure that your populations are aligned with your plans
Have $Amount01Name active Laws
Additional Law slots can be added by unlocking new levels in the Empire Development branch of the Technology Screen

Perhaps RH1nD has simply convinced you to undertake a management experiment on a galactic scale. Their advice has worked, and accompanying changes made within the Academy and other empires seems to have suddenly taken the air out of the rebellious Hero organizations. Is this possible? To manipulate the course of a galaxy via a few carefuly planned administrative changes? Your mind says no, but the results say yes. This inscrutable Sower may be the most impressive of all the Academicians you have encountered. You hope they do not become your enemy.
Secret Chapter: Chiark. A Brush with Madness

You have discovered that the games of Chiark have a very powerful effect on sentient minds. When the games and puzzles are played, an enormous gamble with one's own sanity is taken. Heroes seem to be relatively unaffected, but unenhanced beings who attempt the challenges come back with deformity, death, or madness as often as they return with riches, knowledge, and insight. The planet is a game, and a gamble, and clearly intended for the gods. Are you tempted?
THE ULTIMATE GAME
The place is a tangle of mysteries and puzzles. Some of them are so odd and compelling, that a mere sidelong glance seems to entrap your mind. It is not a place to be taken lightly.
Secret Chapter: Mezan. Alone in a Large Universe

Time and curiosity have helped your scientists and archeologists piece together the mysteries of Mezan's past. It was deserted millenia ago, and there are no clear records covering what exactly occurred in its final days. Was it invasion? Rebellion? Catastrophe? The different ships that left to explore the reaches of space departed decades, even centuries apart. And yet, at the end, the planet died or was destroyed. What is troubling is that the most likely answer points to invasion, and the planet's destruction by violence and plague. This answers one question, but not the biggest one--who did that, and where are they?
SOLITUDE
You are in control of the ancient planet from which your ancestors originated. But it is a source of questions rathern than comfort.
Secret Chapter: Teonha. Involuntary Neurosurgery

The Bhagbha are not a hive mind that shares a single consciousness, but rather individual, functioning offspring of a primary symbiote. Teonha is the central mind, and when it is colonized, and its ecology changed, the effect is quite like having sombody poke around inside your brain without asking permission. It is rather impolite. There are additional side effects on those who visit the planet; they are assailed by strange visions and dreams as the neural activity of the planet ebbs and flows like the movement of currents. Others' brains can also be affected by this force that affects the Bhagbha, and the result is this unusual mental activity.
ENRAGED
Placating the Bhagbha who are offended by your apparently callous actions turns out to be a very worthwhile effort. Sentient being management is never a simple thing.
+5 [prestigeColored] per [bhagabas] Bhagaba [population]
Event: Chiark
Event: Mezan
Event: Teonha
Celestial Worlds
Endless Space 2 - Celestial Worlds brings a multiple-endings questline of 14 chapters, 2 new Unique Planets, 6 new Weapon Modules and 8 new Empire Improvements!
Unique Planets
Idea Incubator

The on-site study of Unique Planets generates volumes of technical and scientific data. Working with this data in the Idea Incubator, engineers and researchers develop and test a multitude of processes and programs to increase the output of scientific and industrial sites.
+50% [industryColored] on System with a colonized Unique Planet and a Governor.
+50% [scienceColored] on System with a colonized Unique Planet and a Governor.
Idea Incubator
Advanced Extraction Research

The unusual--and ancient--infrastructure of Unique Planets, often due to extreme scientific anomalies or advanced technology, provide a ripe playground for discovering new ways to exploit natural resources. Testing and development centers, funneling data and discoveries from these sites, provide radical improvements in Dust and Food production.
+50% [foodColored] on System with a colonized Unique Planet and a Governor.
+50% [dustColored] on System with a colonized Unique Planet and a Governor.
Advanced Extraction Research
Empire Academy

Part of your Hero's assignment is to pass on some of the knowledge and techniques of management learned at the Academy. While the effects are not as great and the participants have not been enhanced by Dust, the lessons from the Hero improve the output of your population.
Immigrant Integration

One positive outcome of Ighszraasz's demands has been an increase in the recruitment of scientific talent from other populations. Driven by the dreams of the Academy and now wholly integrated into your established scientific communities, their productivity explodes thanks to their sense of inclusion and belonging.
Academy of Finance and Investment

Isyander has accepted your gift, and in return builds a university dedicated to making minor populations help to run your empire more efficiently. While this is clearly a political gift, strongly aligned with Isyander's convictions, it is also very pragmatic.
+2% [dustColored] on Empire per Assimilated Minor Faction
Endless Methods

The archaeological sites on Muvel have yielded enormous volumes of information both on the Endless and the Lost. This knowledge has been one of the key reasons for the continued growth of the Academy's political and military power. Believing that you are an ally, Isyander is prepared to share some of this information with you.
+5% [dustColored] on Empire per Technology Stage 5 Unlocked
Game Master
The discovery of the Chiark node, and a mere handful of its secrets, has an immediate effect on the Heroes that help to manage your systems.
+2% [dustColored] on Empire Governor Assigned.
Mezan Military
The discovery of Mezan galvanizes the Admirals leading your fleets. They begin rigorous measures to support the notion of an expedition to the fabled planet.
+2% [dustColored] on Empire Admiral Assigned.
Shock Troopers
Enthusiastic volunteers using inexpensive, state-of-the-art training systems become operational more quickly--before they lose their eagerness to fight.
Progressive Regiments
As the torrent of information from Unique Planets and the Endless sites increases, armored regiments are increasingly rapid to develop, upgrade, and automate.
Stellar Strikecraft
Materials and communications sciences, culled from Unique Planets and Endless technology, lead to rapid advances in the efficiency and capbility of atmospheric aircraft.
Fatal Combat Systems
Technology gleaned from the sites where the Endless harvested the Lost yields disturbingly effective advances in combat systems.
Scavenged Ramscoop
Tetral Probes
Probe Microfactory
Tactical Learning System
Debris Integrator
Scent of Victory
Distance Traveled per Movement Point
Experience per Battle
Infantry Manpower cost
Armor Manpower cost
Air Manpower cost
